intro: Clidemia tillettii, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in cymes, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptic to ovate, and covered with fine, soft hairs. Clidemia tillettii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland areas of Hawaii.
